00154 /* MIDAS library version number. This value is returned by 
00155    cm_get_version and will be incremented whenever changes are done
00156    to the MIDAS library. First digit is major release, second
00157    digit is minor release, third digit is patch level */
00158 
00179 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
00180 
00181 #include "midasinc.h"
00182 
00184 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
00185 
00194 #define DRI_16              (1<<0)  
00195 #define DRI_32              (1<<1)  
00196 #define DRI_64              (1<<2)  
00197 #define DRI_LITTLE_ENDIAN   (1<<3)  
00198 #define DRI_BIG_ENDIAN      (1<<4)  
00199 #define DRF_IEEE            (1<<5)  
00200 #define DRF_G_FLOAT         (1<<6)  
00201 #define DR_ASCII            (1<<7)   /* end of msdefineh */
00205 
00211 /* Byte and Word swapping big endian <-> little endian */
00214 #define WORD_SWAP(x) { BYTE _tmp;                               \
00215                        _tmp= *((BYTE *)(x));                    \
00216                        *((BYTE *)(x)) = *(((BYTE *)(x))+1);     \
00217                        *(((BYTE *)(x))+1) = _tmp; }
00218 
00221 #define DWORD_SWAP(x) { BYTE _tmp;                              \
00222                        _tmp= *((BYTE *)(x));                    \
00223                        *((BYTE *)(x)) = *(((BYTE *)(x))+3);     \
00224                        *(((BYTE *)(x))+3) = _tmp;               \
00225                        _tmp= *(((BYTE *)(x))+1);                \
00226                        *(((BYTE *)(x))+1) = *(((BYTE *)(x))+2); \
00227                        *(((BYTE *)(x))+2) = _tmp; }
00228 
00231 #define QWORD_SWAP(x) { BYTE _tmp;                              \
00232                        _tmp= *((BYTE *)(x));                    \
00233                        *((BYTE *)(x)) = *(((BYTE *)(x))+7);     \
00234                        *(((BYTE *)(x))+7) = _tmp;               \
00235                        _tmp= *(((BYTE *)(x))+1);                \
00236                        *(((BYTE *)(x))+1) = *(((BYTE *)(x))+6); \
00237                        *(((BYTE *)(x))+6) = _tmp;               \
00238                        _tmp= *(((BYTE *)(x))+2);                \
00239                        *(((BYTE *)(x))+2) = *(((BYTE *)(x))+5); \
00240                        *(((BYTE *)(x))+5) = _tmp;               \
00241                        _tmp= *(((BYTE *)(x))+3);                \
00242                        *(((BYTE *)(x))+3) = *(((BYTE *)(x))+4); \
00243                        *(((BYTE *)(x))+4) = _tmp; }
00244  /* end of msmacroh */

00276 /* Mapping of function names for socket operations */
00277 
00278 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
00279 
00280 #define closesocket(s) close(s)
00281 #define ioctlsocket(s,c,d) ioctl(s,c,d)
00282 #define malloc(i) farmalloc(i)
00283 
00284 #undef NET_TCP_SIZE
00285 #define NET_TCP_SIZE 0x7FFF
00286 
00287 #undef MAX_EVENT_SIZE
00288 #define MAX_EVENT_SIZE 4096
00289 
00290 #endif                          /* OS_MSDOS */
00291 
00292 #ifdef OS_VMS
00293 
00294 #define closesocket(s) close(s)
00295 #define ioctlsocket(s,c,d)
00296 
00297 #ifndef FD_SET
00298 typedef struct {
00299    INT fds_bits;
00300 } fd_set;
00301 
00302 #define FD_SET(n, p)    ((p)->fds_bits |= (1 << (n)))
00303 #define FD_CLR(n, p)    ((p)->fds_bits &= ~(1 << (n)))
00304 #define FD_ISSET(n, p)  ((p)->fds_bits & (1 << (n)))
00305 #define FD_ZERO(p)      ((p)->fds_bits = 0)
00306 #endif                          /* FD_SET */
00307 
00308 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
00309

00314 #define P_WAIT   0
00315 #define P_NOWAIT 1
00316 #define P_DETACH 4
00317 
00318 #endif
00319 
00320 /* and for UNIX */
00321 
00322 #ifdef OS_UNIX
00323 
00324 #define closesocket(s) close(s)
00325 #define ioctlsocket(s,c,d) ioctl(s,c,d)
00326 
00327 #define P_WAIT   0
00328 #define P_NOWAIT 1
00329 #define P_DETACH 4
00330 
00331 extern char **environ;
00332 
00333 #endif

00336 #define FD_SETSIZE 32
00337 #endif

00355 /* min/max/abs macros */
00356 #ifndef MAX
00357 #define MAX(a,b)            (((a) > (b)) ? (a) : (b))
00358 #endif
00359 
00360 #ifndef MIN
00361 #define MIN(a,b)            (((a) < (b)) ? (a) : (b))
00362 #endif
00363 
00364 #ifndef ABS
00365 #define ABS(a)              (((a) < 0)   ? -(a) : (a))
00366 #endif
00367 
00368 /* missing tell() for some operating systems */
00369 #define TELL(fh) lseek(fh, 0, SEEK_CUR)
00370

00373 #define MAX_SHM_SIZE      0x20000       /* 128k */
00374 #endif

00380 typedef struct {
00381    DWORD routine_id;            /* routine ID like ID_BM_xxx    */
00382    DWORD param_size;            /* size in Bytes of parameter   */
00383 } NET_COMMAND_HEADER;
00384 
00385 typedef struct {
00386    NET_COMMAND_HEADER header;
00387    char param[32];              /* parameter array              */
00388 } NET_COMMAND;
00389 
00390 
00391 typedef struct {
00392    DWORD serial_number;
00393    DWORD sequence_number;
00394 } UDP_HEADER;

00420 typedef struct {
00421    char host_name[HOST_NAME_LENGTH];    /*  server name        */
00422    INT port;                    /*  ip port                 */
00423    char exp_name[NAME_LENGTH];  /*  experiment to connect   */
00424    int send_sock;               /*  tcp send socket         */
00425    INT remote_hw_type;          /*  remote hardware type    */
00426    char client_name[NAME_LENGTH];       /* name of remote client    */
00427    INT transport;               /*  RPC_TCP/RPC_FTCP        */
00428    INT rpc_timeout;             /*  in milliseconds         */
00429 
00430 } RPC_CLIENT_CONNECTION;
00431

00433    char host_name[HOST_NAME_LENGTH];    /*  server name        */
00434    INT port;                    /*  ip port                 */

00436    int send_sock;               /*  tcp send socket         */

00439    INT remote_hw_type;          /*  remote hardware type    */
00440    INT transport;               /*  RPC_TCP/RPC_FTCP        */
00441    INT rpc_timeout;             /*  in milliseconds         */
00442 
00443 } RPC_SERVER_CONNECTION;

00453    INT transport;               /*  RPC_TCP/RPC_FTCP        */

00458    char *ev_net_buffer;
00459    INT net_buffer_size;         /*  size of TCP cache       */

00502 typedef struct {
00503    char name[NAME_LENGTH];      /* name of database           */
00504    INT version;                 /* database version           */
00505    INT num_clients;             /* no of active clients       */
00506    INT max_client_index;        /* index of last client       */
00507    INT key_size;                /* size of key area in bytes  */
00508    INT data_size;               /* size of data area in bytes */
00509    INT root_key;                /* root key offset            */
00510    INT first_free_key;          /* first free key memory      */
00511    INT first_free_data;         /* first free data memory     */
00512 
00513    DATABASE_CLIENT client[MAX_CLIENTS]; /* entries for clients        */
00514 
00515 } DATABASE_HEADER;
00516 
00517 /* Per-process buffer access structure (descriptor) */
00518 
00519 typedef struct {
00520    char name[NAME_LENGTH];      /* Name of database             */
00521    BOOL attached;               /* TRUE if database is attached */
00522    INT client_index;            /* index to CLIENT str. in buf. */
00523    DATABASE_HEADER *database_header;    /* pointer to database header   */
00524    void *database_data;         /* pointer to database data     */
00525    HNDLE mutex;                 /* mutex/semaphore handle       */
00526    INT lock_cnt;                /* flag to avoid multiple locks */
00527    HNDLE shm_handle;            /* handle (id) to shared memory */
00528    INT index;                   /* connection index / tid       */
00529    BOOL protect;                /* read/write protection        */
00530 
00531 } DATABASE;
00532 
00533 /* Open record descriptor */
00534 
00535 typedef struct {
00536    HNDLE handle;                /* Handle of record base key  */
00537    HNDLE hDB;                   /* Handle of record's database */
00538    WORD access_mode;            /* R/W flags                  */
00539    void *data;                  /* Pointer to local data      */
00540    void *copy;                  /* Pointer of copy to data    */
00541    INT buf_size;                /* Record size in bytes       */
00542    void (*dispatcher) (INT, INT, void *);       /* Pointer to dispatcher func. */
00543    void *info;                  /* addtl. info for dispatcher */
00544 
00545 } RECORD_LIST;
00546 
00547 /* Event request descriptor */
00548 
00549 typedef struct {
00550    INT buffer_handle;           /* Buffer handle */
00551    short int event_id;          /* same as in EVENT_HEADER */
00552    short int trigger_mask;
00553    void (*dispatcher) (HNDLE, HNDLE, EVENT_HEADER *, void *);   /* Dispatcher func. */
00554 
00555 } REQUEST_LIST;

00565 #define CHN_SETTINGS_STR(_name) char *_name[] = {\
00566 "[Settings]",\
00567 "Active = BOOL : 1",\
00568 "Type = STRING : [8] Disk",\
00569 "Filename = STRING : [256] run%05d.mid",\
00570 "Format = STRING : [8] MIDAS",\
00571 "Compression = INT : 0",\
00572 "ODB dump = BOOL : 1",\
00573 "Log messages = DWORD : 0",\
00574 "Buffer = STRING : [32] SYSTEM",\
00575 "Event ID = INT : -1",\
00576 "Trigger mask = INT : -1",\
00577 "Event limit = DWORD : 0",\
00578 "Byte limit = DOUBLE : 0",\
00579 "Tape capacity = DOUBLE : 0",\
00580 "Subdir format = STRING : [32]",\
00581 "Current filename = STRING : [256]",\
00582 "",\
00583 "[Statistics]",\
00584 "Events written = DOUBLE : 0",\
00585 "Bytes written = DOUBLE : 0",\
00586 "Bytes written total = DOUBLE : 0",\
00587 "Files written = INT : 0",\
00588 "",\
00589 NULL}
